Posts.Content: They have to start out slow with that chemo.   I yahood it to find out everything it is not pretty.  My sister in law has it as well.
Posts.Title: Treatment for: carcinomatous meningitis

Posts.Content: My sister in law has had this for a while right now the only thing we can see it is affecting is her hands and feet they feel numb all the time.  She is getting more defiant.  They told her this week she has to have chemo twice a week now in her back.  We have been working toward a stem cell transplant.  Oh another thing is she is hyper sensitive to cold and smells.  I am her primary care giver.  I moved in July to help and carry her to doctor appts and chemo.  She has had some radiation in her right eye to shrink the lymphoma in it and it worked it is down to the size of a very small seed.  Did not get rid of it though.  She started out with Mantle Cell Lymphoma so the way I am reading all of this some of the cancer treatments caused this meningitis.  By making it spread to the Brain and Spine.  Lord help us all!  I am praying for you all on this site!
Posts.Title: Treatment for: carcinomatous meningitis

Posts.Content: My sister in law passed away New Years Eve 2013 sad day

Posts.Content: We are in Georgia as well, being treated at MCG cancer clinic!

Posts.Content: Does anyone know anything about the new pill the FDA has approved for this disease?
Posts.Title: Treatment for: carcinomatous meningitis

Posts.Content: On Jan 27, 2002 12:00 AM Georgia_E wrote: My sister-in-law was recently diagnosed with this cancer in her spinal fluid and the meningeal lining of the brain. Family (ALL of us) are looking for ANY and all information that we get regarding treatment options, prognosis, any survivors or at least how long? What can we expect, what can she expect? PLEASE help. The primary cancer was of the right breast. Intrathecal Chemotherapy (Ommaya Reservoir) was attempted but stopped after 4 treatments due to toxic reaction to Methotrexate. Georgia My sister-in-law contracted this after being diagnosed with Mantle Cell Lymphoma and we are wondering the same.
